channel.title: Copilot on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in Copilot on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: github: Copilot usage metrics now includes enterprise-level GitHub Copilot CLI activity
item.description:
GitHub Copilot enterprise usage metrics now include GitHub Copilot CLI telemetry, expanding what’s counted in enterprise-level reporting.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot metrics is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub Copilot usage metrics are now generally available, providing a centralized view of team adoption and usage.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot metrics report URLs update
item.description:
GitHub Copilot usage metrics API download URLs are now served from a new endpoint; report data, API contract, and response schema are unchanged.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot Content Exclusion REST API in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot adds a new Content Exclusion REST API (JSON) in public preview for organization and enterprise admins to manage Copilot content exclusion rules programmatically.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Mobile: Track coding agent progress in real time with Live Notifications
item.description:
GitHub Mobile now supports Live Coding Agent Notifications to monitor Copilot coding agent activity and supported third-party agent sessions in real time from the mobile app.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Org-level metrics API now includes pull request throughput metric parity
item.description:
GitHub expanded the organization-level Copilot Usage Metrics API to add pull request activity metrics, bringing the org-level endpoints closer to other metrics parity.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Generate pull request titles with Copilot on the web
item.description:
GitHub Copilot can now generate pull request titles directly on github.com when creating or editing a PR.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GPT-5.3-Codex is now available in github.com, GitHub Mobile, and Visual Studio
item.description:
GPT-5.3-Codex is generally available for GitHub Copilot paid tiers and can be used via Copilot Chat across github.com, GitHub Mobile, and Visual Studio.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Improved web search in Copilot on github.com
item.description:
Copilot Chat on github.com now supports model-native web search for certain models, allowing those models to use their built-in web browsing capability during chats.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot CLI is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub Copilot CLI is now generally available for all paid GitHub Copilot subscribers.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Organization-level Copilot usage metrics dashboard available in public preview
item.description:
GitHub has added an organization-level GitHub Copilot usage metrics dashboard in public preview, expanding access beyond enterprise-only dashboards.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot support in Zed generally available
item.description:
GitHub Copilot support in the Zed editor is now generally available via an official partnership. Copilot subscriptions (Pro, Pro+, Business, Enterprise) can authenticate and be used directly in Zed.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent model picker for Copilot Business and Enterprise
item.description:
GitHub announced a model picker for Copilot coding agent for Copilot Business and Enterprise users.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Selected Anthropic and OpenAI models are now deprecated
item.description:
GitHub deprecated a set of Anthropic and OpenAI models across all GitHub Copilot experiences effective February 17, 2026.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Pull request throughput and time to merge available in Copilot usage metrics API
item.description:
GitHub Copilot usage metrics APIs now include pull request outcomes metrics, enabling org-level reporting on PR throughput and time to merge.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Assign issues to Copilot coding agent from Raycast
item.description:
GitHub Copilot coding agent can now be assigned issues directly from Raycast, enabling you to delegate tasks to the agent and later review its work.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Network configuration changes for Copilot coding agent
item.description:
GitHub announced upcoming network configuration changes for Copilot coding agent, which runs background tasks in its own GitHub Actions-powered environment.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Mobile: Model picker for Copilot coding agent
item.description:
GitHub Mobile now lets Copilot Pro and Pro+ subscribers select an AI model when starting a Copilot coding agent session.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: vscode: Your Home for Multi-Agent Development
item.description:
VS Code adds a unified interface to manage multiple coding agents (local, background, and cloud) from one place. It supports using third-party agents like Claude and Codex alongside Copilot and emphasizes interoperability via MCP and Agent Skills.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: github: Showing tool calls and other improvements to Copilot chat on the web
item.description:
GitHub Copilot Chat on github.com now shows tool call details in chat responses and includes additional performance and UX improvements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Closing down notice of legacy Copilot metrics APIs
item.description:
GitHub is closing down three legacy Copilot metrics APIs as it transitions to newer, more comprehensive usage metrics endpoints. Support for the legacy APIs will be limited, and users should plan to migrate to the updated endpoints.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: ACP support in Copilot CLI is now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot CLI now supports the Agent Client Protocol (ACP), an industry-standard protocol that allows AI agents and clients to communicate, and this feature is available in public preview to enable easier integration with third-party tools, IDEs, and automation systems.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Introducing the Agents tab in your repository
item.description:
GitHub added a new Agents tab inside repositories to manage Copilot coding agent tasks. The update brings a mission-control style interface and refreshed look and feel so you can run and oversee agents directly from the repository.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot now supports OpenCode
item.description:
GitHub announced a formal partnership with OpenCode that enables authentication of GitHub Copilot subscriptions (Pro, Pro+, Business, Enterprise) on the OpenCode platform, allowing subscribers to use Copilot with OpenCode.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Agentic memory for GitHub Copilot is in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that Agentic Copilot memory is in public preview for all paid GitHub Copilot plans. The feature lets Copilot learn and retain useful details about your repositories to provide more context-aware assistance as you work.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot CLI: Enhanced agents, context management, and new ways to install
item.description:
GitHub announced updates to Copilot CLI that deliver enhanced agent capabilities, improved context management for terminal workflows, and additional installation options to make the tool easier to adopt and more native to developer terminals.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot Memory early access for Pro and Pro+
item.description:
GitHub announced that Copilot Memory is now available in early access for Copilot Pro and Pro+ users. The feature is supported in the Copilot Coding Agent and Copilot Code Review. The provided article text is truncated; full details are on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Assigning GitHub Copilot to an issue now adds you as an assignee
item.description:
When you assign an issue to GitHub Copilot, you are now automatically added as an assignee so you can track that work more easily with assignee filters.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot now supports Agent Skills
item.description:
GitHub Copilot now supports Agent Skills — self-contained folders of instructions, scripts, and resources that teach Copilot to perform specialized, repeatable tasks and workflows.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot code review preview features now supported in GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency now supports Copilot code review preview features, enabling organizations to try agentic code review capabilities directly in pull requests while keeping data within their residency region.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Dynamic Copilot prompts on GitHub Docs
item.description:
GitHub announced dynamic Copilot prompts on GitHub Docs, allowing users to launch GitHub Copilot prompts directly from select documentation pages to move seamlessly from reading docs to using Copilot.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot code review now available for organization members without a license
item.description:
GitHub announced that organizations on Copilot Enterprise or Copilot Business can run Copilot code review on all pull requests, including those authored by members who do not have an individual Copilot license; usage is billed seamlessly to the organization.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Track organization Copilot usage
item.description:
GitHub announced Copilot usage APIs that let organizations retrieve aggregated and user-specific usage metrics, including statistics for different Copilot features, to monitor adoption and consumption.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: More accurate Copilot Autofix usage metrics on security overview
item.description:
GitHub updated the security overview dashboard to provide more accurate metrics for CodeQL alerts fixed using Copilot autofixes by refining how autofix usage is calculated, improving visibility into adoption and effectiveness without changing the fixes themselves.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Auto model selection is generally available in GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio Code
item.description:
GitHub Copilot’s auto model selection is now generally available in Visual Studio Code for all Copilot plans. The ‘auto’ setting lets Copilot automatically pick the most appropriate model for you based on current model and context.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: Microsoft Learn MCP Server Elevates Development
item.description:
Microsoft’s Learn MCP server improves the Copilot developer experience by providing practical examples and clear integration steps for Visual Studio, Visual Studio Code, the Copilot CLI, and the Copilot Coding Agent.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: github: Model picker for Copilot coding agent for Copilot Pro and Pro+ subscribers
item.description:
GitHub added a model picker to the Copilot coding agent so Copilot Pro and Pro+ subscribers can choose which model the asynchronous background agent uses when starting tasks from the agents UI.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Track Copilot code generation metrics in a dashboard
item.description:
GitHub added Copilot lines-of-code (LoC) metrics to the code generation insights dashboard. Administrators can view these metrics for their enterprise via the Enterprises page.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: OpenAI’s GPT-5.1-Codex-Max is now in public preview for GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub announced that OpenAI’s GPT-5.1-Codex-Max is rolling out in public preview for GitHub Copilot and will be available to Copilot Pro, Pro+, Business, and Enterprise customers.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Assign issues to Copilot using the API
item.description:
GitHub added the ability to assign issues to Copilot via both the GraphQL and REST APIs, with options to set the target repository and base branch and to provide custom instructions and custom agents for how Copilot should handle the issue.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot agent sessions from external apps are now available on GitHub Mobile for Android
item.description:
GitHub Mobile for Android adds a new Android sharesheet custom action that lets you share content from other apps to start Copilot agent sessions directly in the mobile app.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Linter integration with Copilot code review now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot Code Review now integrates linter feedback directly into code reviews and lets repositories specify which linters to use via repository rulesets. The feature is available in public preview so teams can start surfacing and customizing actionable linter suggestions within reviews.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Enterprise bring your own key (BYOK) for GitHub Copilot is now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that Enterprise Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) for GitHub Copilot is now in public preview. The feature responds to enterprise demand for greater flexibility, enabling teams that already use specific LLM providers or custom models to integrate those workflows with Copilot.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot CLI: New models, enhanced code search, and better image support
item.description:
GitHub announced updates to Copilot CLI that add support for the latest AI models, improve code search capabilities, provide better image handling, and include reliability and performance enhancements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Auto model selection for Copilot in JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot now offers an Auto model selection option in Copilot Chat for JetBrains IDEs, Xcode, and Eclipse. Selecting Auto lets Copilot choose the most appropriate model for you; the feature is available in public preview.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot Next Edit Suggestions (NES) now in public preview for Xcode and Eclipse
item.description:
GitHub announced that Copilot Next Edit Suggestions (NES) is now in public preview for Xcode and Eclipse. The feature offers next-logical-edit suggestions to help developers move faster, and the announcement appears on the GitHub Blog changelog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: New SQL Server migration in Azure Arc
item.description:
Azure announced general availability of a new SQL Server migration solution in Azure Arc that streamlines migrations to Azure SQL Managed Instance by combining Azure Database Migration Service with Copilot to provide an automated, end-to-end migration experience.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Internal MCP registry and allowlist controls for VS Code Stable in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that enterprise and organization administrators can configure internal MCP registries and enforce allowlist policies in the latest VS Code Stable release (public preview), extending governance controls to the majority of Copilot users.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Copilot observability agent
item.description:
Azure announced the public preview of the Azure Copilot observability agent — a new agent aimed at giving cloud operations intelligent, scalable observability that provides actionable insights when services aren’t performing as expected.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Fine-grain permissions for Copilot usage metrics now available
item.description:
GitHub added a fine-grain enterprise role—“View enterprise Copilot metrics”—that grants access to the Copilot Usage Metrics APIs and the Copilot Usage Dashboard so assigned users can view enterprise-level Copilot usage data.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Configure Copilot coding agent as a bypass actor for rulesets
item.description:
GitHub added an option to configure the Copilot coding agent as a bypass actor for repository rulesets, so Copilot-driven activity can be exempted from rules that would otherwise block automation or generated commits.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot code review and coding agent now support agent-specific instructions
item.description:
GitHub added support for agent-specific custom instructions for Copilot code review and the Copilot coding agent by introducing an excludeAgent property in .instructions.md files, letting you control when particular instructions apply or are ignored.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: The legacy Copilot usage report CSV is no longer available
item.description:
GitHub has retired the legacy Copilot usage report CSV that organization administrators could access under Copilot access settings; the report was deprecated three months earlier and is now no longer available.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent supports organization custom instructions
item.description:
GitHub announced that the Copilot coding agent — its asynchronous, autonomous background agent — now supports organization-level custom instructions to guide how Copilot understands and works with projects.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent now supports pull request templates
item.description:
GitHub’s Copilot coding agent, an autonomous background agent that creates and updates pull requests with a summary of its changes, now supports repository pull request templates so its generated PR bodies follow your repo’s template while still inserting the agent’s summary.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: vscode: A Unified Experience for all Coding Agents
item.description:
The article announces that coding agents have become central to VS Code in 2025, describing new agent mode, Copilot integration, and the GitHub Copilot CLI while noting the growing ecosystem of agents from providers like OpenAI and Anthropic.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot policy update for unconfigured policies
item.description:
GitHub fixed an issue that sometimes caused organization-level Copilot policies to display incorrect options when the enterprise-level policy was set to “Unconfigured.” The change ensures organizations now see the correct Copilot policy options in that scenario.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Delegate AI controls management to members of your enterprise
item.description:
GitHub now lets enterprise owners delegate management of AI and Copilot policies and setup administration to specific enterprise members and teams, without requiring broad enterprise ownership.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot policy now supports agent mode in the IDE
item.description:
GitHub admins can now control access to Copilot’s agent mode in IDEs through the Copilot policies page on github.com. The change is intended to give organizations better governance over who can use agent mode in development environments.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Control AI spending with budget tracking for GitHub AI tools
item.description:
GitHub announced budget-tracking controls for AI tools and the launch of two new premium request SKUs for the GitHub Copilot coding agent and GitHub Spark to help teams manage AI spending as usage grows.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: A mission control to assign, steer, and track Copilot coding agent tasks
item.description:
GitHub redesigned the Copilot coding agent task management experience on github.com into a single “mission control” interface that lets you assign, steer, and track tasks without jumping between pages.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Code Quality in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Code Quality is now available in public preview, bringing in‑context findings, one‑click Copilot fixes, and reliability and maintainability scores directly into pull requests to help improve code during review.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: New public preview features in Copilot code review: AI reviews that see the full picture
item.description:
GitHub announced new public preview features for Copilot code review that combine LLM detections and tool-calling with deterministic analyzers (for example ESLint and CodeQL) to produce smarter, more comprehensive reviews and enable a smooth handoff to the Copilot coding agent.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Work with Copilot coding agent in Slack
item.description:
The GitHub app for Slack now integrates with the GitHub Copilot coding agent, enabling users to generate pull requests directly from Slack conversations. The feature is rolling out and announced on the GitHub Blog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot for Linear available in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that Copilot for Linear is available in public preview. Users can assign Linear issues to the Copilot coding agent — an asynchronous, autonomous background agent — which will analyze the issue contents.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Enterprise AI controls & the agent control plane are in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced an enterprise-level experience for administrative functions for AI systems called the agent control plane, now available in public preview to all GitHub Enterprise Cloud customers using Copilot.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot usage metrics dashboard and API in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that a Copilot usage metrics dashboard and a corresponding API are available in public preview for GitHub Enterprise, allowing organizations to view and programmatically access Copilot usage metrics.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Ask Copilot coding agent to make changes in any pull request with @copilot
item.description:
GitHub’s Copilot coding agent can now edit existing pull requests created by humans when you mention @copilot in a comment, in addition to its ability to open new pull requests from scratch.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent now supports self-hosted runners
item.description:
GitHub announced that Copilot coding agents can now run their development environment on self-hosted GitHub Actions runners managed by Actions Runner Controller (ARC), enabling teams to host agent workloads in their own infrastructure.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot knowledge bases can now be converted to Copilot Spaces
item.description:
GitHub announced a migration option that lets users convert legacy Copilot knowledge bases into Copilot Spaces ahead of the knowledge bases’ sunset on November 1, 2025.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent can now search the web
item.description:
GitHub’s Copilot coding agent — an asynchronous autonomous background agent that can open draft pull requests and make changes for you — can now search the web to gather information and references to inform its code changes and suggestions.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent uses better branch names and pull request titles
item.description:
GitHub announced that the Copilot coding agent — the asynchronous background agent that works on delegated tasks and requests reviews — now generates clearer, more descriptive branch names and pull request titles to improve reviewability and repo hygiene.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot CLI: Faster, more concise, and prettier
item.description:
GitHub announced incremental updates to GitHub Copilot CLI focused on speed, more concise suggestions, and improved output formatting. The changes reflect daily improvements driven by community feedback and are listed in the GitHub Blog changelog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot CLI: Enhanced model selection, image support, and streamlined UI
item.description:
GitHub announced updates to Copilot CLI that add enhanced model selection, support for images, and a streamlined user interface following the product’s public preview and active user feedback.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Start your new repository with Copilot coding agent
item.description:
GitHub added a new Prompt field on the New repository page that lets you use the Copilot coding agent to kickstart work when creating a repository, announced on the GitHub Blog changelog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Anthropic Claude Sonnet 4.5 is in public preview for Copilot coding agent
item.description:
GitHub Copilot’s asynchronous coding agent now supports Anthropic’s Claude Sonnet 4.5. The integration is available in public preview and connects Copilot coding agent with Anthropic’s most advanced model for coding and real‑world agent tasks.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent remembers context within the same pull request
item.description:
GitHub’s Copilot coding agent — an asynchronous background developer agent that opens draft pull requests, makes changes, and requests review — now remembers context within the same pull request, allowing it to maintain continuity across related tasks.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Kick off and track Copilot coding agent sessions from the GitHub CLI
item.description:
GitHub added the ability to start and monitor Copilot coding agent sessions from the GitHub CLI. The Copilot coding agent works asynchronously: you delegate a task, it makes changes in the background, opens a draft pull request, and requests a review when finished.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot can create issues with code snippets in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that Copilot can now create issues that include relevant code snippets and files. The capability is available in public preview and aims to make issue reports more actionable by automatically adding code context.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Upcoming deprecation of gh-copilot CLI extension
item.description:
GitHub announced the scheduled deprecation of the GitHub Copilot CLI extension (gh-copilot) for the GitHub CLI; the extension will stop working on October 25, 2025.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot CLI is now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that GitHub Copilot CLI is available in public preview, bringing the Copilot coding agent into the terminal so developers can work locally with AI-assisted coding in their command line workflow.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot coding agent is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub announced that the Copilot coding agent — an asynchronous, autonomous developer agent — is now generally available to all paid Copilot subscribers. Users can delegate tasks to the agent and it will act on their behalf, for example by opening draft pull requests.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot Spaces is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub announced that Copilot Spaces is now generally available (announced 2025-09-24). Copilot Spaces brings richer project context — such as files, pull requests and other project artifacts — into Copilot so the assistant can understand a repository more like a teammate and provide more relevant, context-aware help.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Pick the repository and base branch when assigning issues to Copilot
item.description:
GitHub announced a public preview that adds options when assigning issues to the Copilot coding agent: you can now select the target repository and the base branch for the changes Copilot will propose.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Upcoming deprecation of select Copilot models from Claude, OpenAI, and Gemini
item.description:
GitHub announced it will deprecate select Copilot models provided by Claude, OpenAI, and Gemini as part of routine model retirement to prioritize newer, more capable models and maintain a fast, high‑quality Copilot experience. The post directs users to the changelog for the specific models and migration timeline and urges customers to update integrations to supported models.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot app modernization is now generally available for Java and .NET
item.description:
GitHub Copilot app modernization is now generally available for Java and .NET projects. The feature helps teams assess applications, apply automated code transformations, patch builds, and containerize services quickly—reducing modernization work to days.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Work with Copilot coding agent in Microsoft Teams
item.description:
GitHub’s new app for Microsoft Teams lets you invoke the Copilot coding agent from a Teams conversation to generate pull requests. The Copilot coding agent works asynchronously and autonomously to create PRs directly within Teams.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Assign Azure Boards work items to Copilot coding agent in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced a public preview that lets you assign Azure Boards work items to the Copilot coding agent. The agent works asynchronously and autonomously in the background to implement tasks and open draft pull requests for your review.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot code review: Now in JetBrains IDEs and Visual Studio
item.description:
GitHub announced that Copilot code review is now available directly inside most standard editors and IDEs, including Visual Studio and JetBrains IDEs (such as IntelliJ).

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Upcoming removal of Copilot premium request $0 budgets for enterprise and team accounts
item.description:
Starting November 18, 2025, GitHub will remove all $0 Copilot premium request budgets for enterprise and team accounts that were created before August 22, 2025.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Auto model selection for Copilot in VS Code in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio Code has a new Auto model selection option in public preview that automatically picks the model for you via the model picker.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Internal MCP registry and allowlist controls for VS Code Insiders
item.description:
GitHub announced that enterprise and organization administrators can now configure internal MCP registries and test allowlist enforcement in VS Code Insiders to prepare for a forthcoming rollout across all Copilot environments. The changelog entry points admins to learn about MCP registries and allowlists and to try these controls in the Insiders build.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) support for JetBrains IDEs and Xcode in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) support is now in public preview for GitHub Copilot Chat within JetBrains IDEs and Xcode. Users with a supported API key can use their own key to access Copilot Chat in these IDEs.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot code review: Independent repository rule for automatic reviews
item.description:
GitHub announced a new standalone repository rule that lets you enable automatic Copilot code reviews independently; the feature is now generally available to Copilot users.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: OpenAI GPT-5 and GPT-5 mini are now generally available in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
GitHub announced that OpenAI’s GPT-5 and GPT-5 mini are now generally available in GitHub Copilot. The announcement explicitly states GPT-5 mini is available to all Copilot plans, including Copilot Free; the excerpt does not include full details about GPT-5 plan availability.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Manage Copilot and users via Enterprise Teams in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Cloud launched Enterprise Teams in public preview to simplify enterprise user management and Copilot license administration; enterprise owners can now add users directly to the enterprise and manage Copilot access at the enterprise level.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot code review: Path-scoped custom instruction file support
item.description:
GitHub announced that Copilot code review now supports path-scoped custom instruction files, letting repositories provide targeted review guidance for specific directories or files using existing instruction files.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Create sub-issues with Copilot in public preview
item.description:
GitHub Copilot now supports creating sub-issues and managing issue relationships via chat on github.com/copilot, available in public preview.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot code review: Generally available in Xcode and new admin control
item.description:
Copilot code review is now generally available in Xcode. A new enterprise and organization setting for Copilot code review has been introduced for admins.

  • Source: GitHub
